We had a very disappointing experience. The staff was extremely rude to our Postmates driver and gave us the wrong order. When we tried to contact them to resolve the issue, they disconnected their phones and even blocked our numbers. Despite being open until 12 AM, they refused to answer any of our repeated calls. It‚Äôs clear they have no interest in providing good customer service.

I stopped by to pick up my mobile order, and while the drink itself was fine, the experience left a lot to be desired. When I walked in, I noticed a stack of job applications left out in plain sight right by the pickup counter. These had people‚Äôs full names, addresses, and personal information visible to anyone who walked in. That‚Äôs a serious privacy issue and really unprofessional.

What made things worse was that what appeared to be the owner or manager came in with someone they were interviewing. Instead of acknowledging me or even saying ‚Äúexcuse me,‚Äù they both walked right up to where I was standing‚Äîwell within personal space‚Äîand completely ignored me. No greeting, no acknowledgment, nothing. It was as if I wasn‚Äôt even there.

The saddest part is that this didn‚Äôt seem like a mistake from a new employee or someone who didn‚Äôt know better‚Äîit looked like it was coming directly from management. That‚Äôs disappointing. As a customer, I expect basic courtesy and respect, and I didn‚Äôt get that here.

This could‚Äôve been a simple and smooth pickup experience, but it turned into something that made me feel uncomfortable and disregarded. I hope they take this feedback seriously, especially when it comes to handling private information and interacting with people respectfully.

Service: Take out
Meal type: Lunch
Food: 4
Service: 1
Atmosphere: 1

This could‚Äôve been a simple and smooth pickup experience, but it turned into something that made me feel uncomfortable and disregarded. I hope they take this feedback seriously, especially when it comes to handling private information and interacting with people respectfully.

Being a trojan this was our favorite boba place! I love their Taro and Pistachio flavours! Some of the other flavours I tried are a bit too sweet for me. But others seemed to love it. These 2 are well balanced unique flavours though! I have been here multiple times and will continue going. Their service is quick. The place is small with not much sitting but still cute.

Came in after going to a concert with a group of friends. Was probably around 10-11pm. Service was quick and boba itself was decent (jasmine green tea, horchata flavor, etc were good). Recommend asking for less sugar, seems a little higher than most places. Parking lot is small like most places in LA.

Love that they have a Boba Time near USC now to help make up for the lack of higher quality boba in the area.

With that said, I had the strangest ordering experience trying to get my Teaspresso. I wanted to order an Oolong Milk Tea with Oat Milk and Boba. Sounds pretty simple, but the staff kept telling me that they prepared their drinks with non-dairy milk... which is great, but I kept saying that I would like oat milk instead.

For some reason, this back and forth went for a bit but we eventually got the drink down. I think they were genuinely trying to be helpful and in the end, I did get the drink that I wanted. But since my drink was so simple, I was hoping it would be a simple enough transaction lol.

Either way, the drink was good and the staff did a good job keeping up with the large amount of orders.

Food: 3
Service: 3
Atmosphere: 3
